Reviews.Title: “Rapidly Rising Turkish Star”
Reviews.Author: weatherman1974
Reviews.Content: Like some other TripAdvisor contributors, I discovered Hotel Sultan Hill in the Rick Steves' Istanbul guidebook. The many positive reviews about the hotel here on TripAdvisor convinced me to book it for my vacation to Istanbul. Reserving the room prior to arrival was easy, with all of my e-mails answered promptly by the hotel staff. Upon arrival, the hotel was only a 5 minute walk from the Sultanahmet tram stop. Breakfast every morning consisted of sliced meats and cheeses, sliced tomatoes and cucumbers, dry cereals, dry and fresh fruit, hard-boiled eggs, breads and pastries, GREAT coffee, tea, juice, olives, fresh yogurt, and several jams and spreads. The small but cozy room featured cold air-conditioning, great water pressure in the shower with ample hot water, good sheets on the bed and towels in the bathroom, and Turkish and English (CNN, BBC) channels on the television. The hotel, open since 2005, is overall very clean throughout. Upon check-out, I received a 15% discount on the 60 Euro a night rate for being a follower of Rick Steves and showing his Istanbul guidebook during the check-in process. I am very satisfied that I stayed in this hotel for nine nights, and would readily recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Istanbul. However, this hotel may not be suitable for persons with mobility issues, as the hotel only has stairs and does not have an elevator. Also, anyone with insomnia may not want to choose this hotel, as the last call to prayer at the Blue Mosque next door is around 9:30 pm at night, with the first call to prayer around 5:30 am in the morning. Finally, there are some dilapidated buildings in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but it is my understanding that these will soon be upgraded. However, the hotel's location still felt and was very safe. TripAdvisor currently rates this hotel around #100 of around 700 hotels in Istanbul. There is no doubt in my mind that if the wonderful staff of Hotel Sultan Hill continues to perform at the level that I experienced during my stay, this hotel will soon be a Top 25 hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maltaswede
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location - you are within close walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Haya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace. The staff are wonderful, very friendly. The rooms are rather small (and so it the doublebed) but this is an historical area and the hotel is set in an old house so you cannot expert huge suites. The only downside is that if you are a light sleeper you will be woken up very early (5 am) by the very loud call to prayer from the Blue Mosque, by loudspeakers. At the same time it's great to stay so close to this historical area and it certainly adds to the atmosphere (but not to the sleepquality).

Reviews.Title: “it's been a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Lerai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights in the very end of March. We were surprised with how close it was to the Blue Mosque: it is literally just around the corner ans some 20 meters more. The room was clean, authentically furnished and moderately small. Although, visiting friends who stayed in other hotels (even the 5-stars ones), I could see that the rooms do not get much bigger at all: must have to do with how packed the whole area of Sultanahmet is. Other things worth mentioning are the terrace with an incredible view and the staff of the hotel - friendly and amazingly helpful. Hotel Sultan Hill is a very peaceful nook, both cosy and charming. P.S. a dog called Caramel is one of the biggest attractions of the City. She can also be found around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel from the Rick Steves book, which got us a 15% discount. The hotel was clean, and the location was great. The Blue Mosque was right across the street, so we heard the call to prayer early each morning (which might bother some people, but we enjoyed it). Free wifi in the room, and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooftop Views, Accommodating Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: shamrock1978
Reviews.Content: I believe I found out about this hotel from a Rick Steves review; it did not disappoint! I was only booked for a 3 day stay at the hotel, however, due to the Icelandic volcano that shut European air traffic down, my trip was extended to approximately 2 weeks. The hotel staff was so incredibly accomodating and made room for my prolonged stay. The location was within walking distance to all of the major sights. Breakfast was delicious, and included in the room rate (along with wireless internet included). My absolute favorite part of the hotel was the amazing views from the rooftop. It overlooked the beautiful Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. The scene was so beautiful, it was surreal for me. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT.”
Reviews.Author: Docwahoo
Reviews.Content: If you are a crybaby about room size, don't come here; in fact, don't bother traveling if you are a whiner about that kind of thing. Stay home. This place has LOCATION and coolness.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Sultan Hill”
Reviews.Author: Meera D
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was very nice. Rooms are quite small and we did have to keep our suitcases on the desk as not enough space otherwise. Breakfast is lovely & the local cheese is delicious. The location is very central, i.e. close to blue mosque but that does mean you get woken up in the middle of the night due to the mosque call to prayer. Price is normal for that area and service is good. Area by my bed was quite dusty but nothing too drastic. the only other complaint is when we left after breakfast on day one- the smell of the onions being cooked was very sickly ! Nice place if you want to be close to old town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vrichard429
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice small boutique hotel. It is in a great location! My room had access to a balcony which is nice! The staff was friendly and pointed out a nice place to eat. The only downsides were they have key based electricity and mine didn't like to work very well. The other is merely the downside of Sultanahmet which is the mosques are LOUD and you are right by the blue mosque. You will adjust within a couple of days though.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Decent location”
Reviews.Author: charlie15
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel located right behind the Blue Mosque. Good location to discover Sultanahmet. Room and bathroom are basic but clean. Breakfast is ok, nothing to rave about. Regular coffee is really bad though, turkish coffee is available but at additionnal charges, rather surprising for a Turkish hotel Not really recommended for seniors or people with disabilities, the stairs are pretty steep going up to the 3 or 4 th floor. Make sure that the A/C is working in the room. It was not in mine. One last issue, the hotel is literally right behind the Mosque, so one must expect to be abruplty awaken by the loud call of prayers in the morning. It is always an experience the first time. One other suggestion, no need to use the shuttle service from the Hotel (they charge 25 Euros). It is much cheaper to hire a cab. It will cost no more than $ 20 for the ride to Sulthanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness and ease”
Reviews.Author: Aileen C
Reviews.Content: This location of this small wooden hotel is superb as it is within easy walking distance of all the highlights of the old city. The tram is just five minutes walk away so going further is also easy. Our room was small but comfortable and clean. Staff were willing to answer any questions and were unfailingly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth V
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sultan Hill is just behind the Blue Mosque and an easy walk from the end of the Hippodrome. It is in a beautiful old Ottoman house.There was a school behind the hotel - interesting to look at during the day. The stairs are circular and there is no elevator so not a good place for a handicapped person. The rooftop had a great view. It was clean, breakfast room is pleasant and food acceptable (yogurt, olives, cucumbers, tomatoes, toast, watermelon). There were other hotels farther down the hill but people staying there had to hike up and down - we were so close to everything we wanted to see! I think it was the ideal location and a very pleasant small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nancy C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a total of eight nights in May (five nights at the beginning of our three week vacation and three nights at the end). Highly recommended, clean, friendly, close to everything. Our son had been working in Tanzania for the past few years and met us in Istanbul. He was staying at a hostel nearby but was invited to partake in the breakfast buffet with us in the mornings. We appreciated their hospitality, sightseeing advice, and friendliness. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LB5432
Reviews.Content: room was small but clean, adequate and quiet with a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Joe-SVL
Reviews.Content: Sultan Hill (not to be confused with Hotel Sultanhan) has a great location just down a curvey side street off the end of the Hippodrome in the Old Town's Sultanahmet District. The hotel is right below the Blue Mosque so you will hear the call to prayers clearly. There is a 10% discount for cash payment and an additional 5% if you carry the Rick Steves' Istanbul book. There are only 17 rooms in this old Ottoman House. Our room #203 was right off the lobby / reception desk; but it was not noisy. They recently started a bottled wine service in the lobby which is a great way to relax after a day visiting the sights of Istanbul. The breakfast room is downstairs and the buffet breakfasts are great. Outside the breakfast room is a small patio with comfortable seating to enjoy the bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel. Wonderful, friendly, helpful staff. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Andiamo_38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. First of all, the staff is exceptionally nice and helpful. The gentlemen at the front desk are so friendly and they made us feel at home. The lady who manages the breakfast buffet was so thoughtful. One morning I had a sore throat and she noticed I wasn't in full form. She was so solicitous and made me some hot water with lemon and honey. I will never forget how kind she was. The location is perfect!! The room was comfortable and spotlessly clean. Don't miss the roof top terrace with a cold Efes beer from reception. The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque just next door will be an experience you will never forget. We would go back to this hotel any time. By the way, say hi to Caramel. And, TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim !

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, attentive staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: li0nheart
Reviews.Content: Being situated a short walk from the Hippodrome, next to the Blue Mosque, gets you quickly into the action of the Sultanahmet District and beyond. The desk staff is very friendly and helpful, and was quick to respond back and forth to emails when I was trying to book with them on short notice. The free wifi in the room is fast, strong and secure. I was able to get the Rick Steves discount because I was carrying his Istanbul guidebook on my netbook (which I showed them on arrival). I had a nice clean room with plenty of space for my needs, it felt very much like a step back in time to the Ottoman era with the furnishings and woodwork. The street where it is located also feels historic. The carpet shop folks never gave me the hard sell, just a hello as I walked by--after many trips to Turkey I know how to turn off the sales pitch with a smile and determined walk and look. Do take in a shop or two though, I buy something special each trip and have it shipped home--it always arrives quickly and I have made some great friends who work in the shops. Get beyond the sales game and you often find some very good people, remember they are just trying to make a living to support their families. The breakfast is basic, but included free. My room was in the back, so I wasn't too affected by the call to prayer. I needed to catch my flight home very early and Gokchan arranged for a van to get me to the airport--there is someone on the desk all through the night. All in all, it is an excellent place to stay in Istanbul--you will feel very safe, cozy, and at home. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Use Rick Steve's Book & get a discount”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravler1946
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of nine nights. We used the hotel as a base to travel to Jordan and Lebanon and to other parts of Turkey. They were very good about keeping our suitcases when we just took small carry-ons for the plane trips. This also made it easy to use the tram system to get to & from the airport. There are a lot of narrow stairs. We asked for a room on the main floor. The room was small, but very nice. If you are a light sleeper, the call to worship is going to be a problem. The hotel is right behind the Blue Mosque. But it is also very close to all the major sights and the tram is about 15 mins away. They let us use their computer, but if you have your own, they have free wi fi. We used Rick Steve's Book & got a 15% discount even with a credit card. Two of the places he recommends to eat at are a short walk away. Breakfast is included. It's good, but the same everyday. Be sure to shop around before buying anything and bargain, bargain, bargain. I used the hotel's service for the pick up and delivery to the airport for very early flights. It's not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for the price”
Reviews.Author: GrunerVeltiner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sultan Hill is very affordable and literally right behind the Blue Mosque - a fantastic location for sightseeing. The rooms were fairly small and the beds extremely hard, however, and the proximity to the Blue Mosque means daily 4:30am "wake-up calls" from the imam. The street is well-loved by tour groups and buses, too, so not all that quiet. On the plus side, we loved the rooftop terrace for sitting outside with a beer from the fridge at the reception, looking out over the Bosphorus. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was passable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Axel2DP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May 2011. Small but nice, clean room with big comfortable bed. The bathroom is clean and modern. The shower stall has good water pressure, but is the typical European size; so space inside the stall could be tight if you're a big person. The guys manning the front desk were all very nice. 5-10 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, and in good walking distance to other historic sites in Sultanahmet and the Sultanahmet tram station. Highly recommended to anyone wishing to stay in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: SyedCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this family-owned hotel for 8 nights and had a comfortable stay. The english-speaking staff Tarik, Gokhan and manager Sedat were super friendly and helpful in getting bookings and reservations that we needed. The hotel is right next to the Blue Mosque on a fairly quiet street. All the major attractions are within walking distance from the hotel. The Sultanahmet tram station is a short walk away. We took the tram to Kabatas and then the funicular to Taksim Square. We got some of the best money exchange rates with no commission near the Beyazit tram station which was about 15 minutes walk away from the hotel. The entrance gate 5 for the Grand Bazaar (Kapili Karsi) is on to the right. Restaurants are plentiful near Sultan Hill and we tried a few before we settled for one that suited our taste and pocket. Just make sure you ask for the price of anything before you consume it, or else you may end up paying a ridiculous price. There are many dishonest vendors and touts, so save your money! We had some of the best Turkish baklava at Haji Mustafa, just across from Sirkeci station at the corner of Ankara Cad. The manager was friendly and hospitable. The Hoca Pasa cultural center (where we went for the Whirling Dervishes show) is located nearby Sirkeci tram station . Booking was made by the Sultan Hill hotel for us. To and fro from Ataturk airport and hotel was arranged online by ourselves with a private transfer services and it was on-time, fast, affordable and hassle free. If you are looking for any tour, make sure to shop around as the same tour can be sold by agents for a different price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Sultan Hill and liked it very much. The rooms are small but comfortable and the location can't be beat. (Cleanliness was a '3' because I dropped something under the bed and, while the obvious areas were sparkling, it'd be a long time since someone cleaned under the furniture!) The staff was very very helpful and kind (translations, taxis, information, etc.), although there were 'confusions' (forgot to book our airport pick-up , etc.) The hotel is in a perfect location - you can walk about anywhere!! The price is great for the high quality, too. We would absolutely stay here again - the great aspects of the hotel far outweigh any of the details. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - great price”
Reviews.Author: viks23
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 days and loved the hotel. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable. Amazing views from the terrace of the Blue mosque and the Bosphorus. Also, the staff is very friendly. Breakfast is good as well. Highly recommend it if you are looking for value. Location is unbeatable - right by the Blue mosque. It can get a bit noisy as its right by the mosque .. but I slept through the morning azaan and didn't get bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: Recommended by friends, this hotel is in the perfect location for spending a few days exploring Sultanhamet. Easy walking access to all the main sites. The staff were friendly and helpful beyond expectation. The breakfast of yoghurt, cheeses, olives, toast, juices, and coffee was spot on - and the breakfast staff was great! The room was clean and comfortable - and with free wifi, I frequently called friends and family on Skype during the call to prayer to share the ambiance of my experience. Be sure to go up to the rooftop terrace during the day and the night for terrific views of the city, the water, and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Sultanahmet, good value and recommended”
Reviews.Author: CeNedra_YOW
Reviews.Content: Our room was two singles on the main floor off of the lobby. Room was small but perfect for what we needed. Bathroom a good size. Rooms were very, very clean. We got an airport transfer for pickup and were there waiting for us when we landed at Sabiha Gocken airport. Staff were very helpful, informative and courteous. Hotel is situated behind the Blue Mosque, therefore if you wish to sleep in .... unless you're a deep sleeper, you won't. We knew this and the call to prayer can be heard quite early and didn't bother us in the slightest. Breakfast was a fair selection of fruit, juices and toast.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Bustling Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BobHand
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced. Veryu courteous and helpful staff close to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Tram.Go out of their way to accommodate Stored our luggage while we visited Izmer and environs.free of charge. Helped secure transportation to airport and helped to carry to car.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, comfortable, friendly hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: traveller181
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to Turkey. My wife and I stayed 8 - 11 September 2010. It is a short walk from the Sultanamet tram stop. Very easy from the Ataturk airport, about $2 each. The staff were very nice and kind, with great suggestions of where one might eat. You can have your breakfast in the inside area or in the outside garden. A good typical Turkish breakfast. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location, super friendly staff !!”
Reviews.Author: ihatesigningup
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay (4 nights) at Hotel Sultan Hill. Each of the 3 guys at the front desk spoke English very well, were really helpful and friendly giving me good advice on all things Istanbul. Room: I stayed at the basement level, and it was great. I didn't care that I could hear plates and such during breakfast time, it was very slight, and never woke me. The AC was quiet and worked great! The bathroom huge and tons of water pressure, consistent temperature, plenty of towels and such. Excellent. Very comfy bed, nice and firm, I got lots of good rest. Staff: brilliant, Tarek, and Gokhan (Ghek-Han) were fabulous. Setting up shuttle and such to/from airport and recommending good places to eat, laundry etc... Location: right next to Sofia and Blue Mosque, a short walk to everything interesting. Then take the Tram or taxi to Taksim which is amazzzzzzing at night. Taxi to Taksim, by the way from the hotel should be 10 to 12 TL. Anything more is a big red flag, careful! Laundry: the place I went to was upstairs in what looked like a private home, the clothes came back ... kind of clean ? The smelled like smoke, actually because after being washed... they sat in a smoky room. Brilliant. Anyway, they were actually washed and had hints of 'clean' smell mixed with fresh smoke :-) I wouldn't recommend that one (it says "laundry", up a small dark staircase. The hotel correctly no longer sends out laundry, too many missing or dirty items ... WiFi: great anywhere, they have multiple hotspots, just pick the right one. So nice to have reliable wifi after Paris :-) Airport Transfers: hotel charges 60 EUR for a private ride from SAW (not IST, that's much cheaper) but you can always get a shuttle for much less (10EUR from SAW), it'll take you longer. Call the hotel and get their shuttle recommendation. The one I used sometimes doesn't show up, fyi. Taxi: SCAM ALERT !!!! Some (very few) taxi's will steal your money running a scam I embarrassingly fell for. You give him a 50 TL bill which looks just like a 5, he slaps his hand starts yelling at you and turns around with a 5, you get nervous and doubt yourself, all the other taxi guys were great right? (he's big with a big voice, you're in the middle of traffic with cars honking, cigarette smoke in the car, you want to get out ASAP), and hand him another bill, he does the same thing... anyway, YES I feel like an idiot for getting pressured and not hearing my intuition, ... lost 100 TL for a ride that should have cost 12 TL. Ugh, what a loser... fate will find him, I'm sure. Ice Cream mini-scam: some of the flamboyant turkish-icecream vendors (they wear a red cap and use a big metal stick to mix their ice cream for some reason) will charge you 20 TL for two cones... that's $14 US dollars... for two cones. That's $7 a cone. Have you ever paid $7 for a scoop of ice cream, anywhere ? Careful, confirm price first or just let it go. Some local turkish coffee was crap, by the way (sour, probably because tourists can't tell the difference), I'd recommend trying several places, and heading out of the Sultanahmet area (only tourists go there, no turks eat or drink there). The nearby restaurant (tamara something?) was very very good, fyi. Also try Sultanahmet Koeftacici (something like that) across the street from the tram rails, at the east end of the hypodrome park, amazing koefta (kafta), crowded, fast service. See rick steve's book.

Reviews.Title: “With mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrinKo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sultan Hill Hotel in May 2010 for several days. Firstly I didn't like it at all because our room was extremly small and a bed seemed to be too small as well. I even thought about moving to another hotel after the first night there. But then I investigeted the other small hotels in the area and understood that our hotel is not so bad :) Well. pluses are: 1) location - just behind the Blue Mosque 2) very clean room 3) helpfull & friendly stuff (no cheating like in the hotels with local management) 4) breakfast is very basic but you can have it in the cosy yard So my final conclusion - hotel is good enough to be recommended but not for romantic or relaxing trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; fab location; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TequilaDubai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Istanbul, Turkey. Thanks to reviews on TripAdvisor, we found Hotel SultanHill and booked ourselves there and after having visited, I completely agree with all the good reviews this hotel has been given. Its located in the heart of the tourist area where all the sights are within a 10 minute walking distance right from the Blue Mosque to the Hippodrome; Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and comfortable. The two guys who look after the hotel - Gokhan and Tariq are really friendly and helpful and make you feel at home right away. They even go the extra mile in arranging tours and cabs and ordering pizza:-). Thanks to them for all their help and for making our stay in Instanbul very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: Anton37
Reviews.Content: The service we received from Yolcun and Tarik at this very clean and charming hotel was amazing! We enjoyed staying at the Sultan Hill so much that after touring other cities in Turkey we returned to stay again with them. The rooftop terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea was breathtaking. The breakfast each morning was delicious with plenty of food. They gave us great suggestions on restaurants and directions. Our service was always friendly and genuine. The rooms are small yet comfortable, very clean and crisp linens. Air conditioning, clean bathroom and beer and wine that could be purchase in the lobby to take up and enjoy the panoramic view on the roof top. We could walk to all the sights in Sultanahmet and felt safe comfortable. The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque at 4:30 a.m. is rather loud, but that being said, it was part of the Istanbul experience. The Sultan Hill was our home away from home on our first trip to Istanbul. Thank you Yolcun!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish treasure tucked behind the Blue Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: robinita2
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in Rick Steves' Istanbul and was given a discount for showing the book. I arrived in the late evening and was greeted by name when I arrived. Room was small but spotless and the bed was heaven. This hotel is only three years in business and very well kept up. Breakfast served in the lower level was fantastic. A wonderful spread in a pleasant atmosphere. Building also has a rooftop terrace with an amazing view and tables and chairs if you care to get a bottle of wine available in the lobby to enjoy. I was very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: AlohaCharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 5 thru 11, 2010. Payed 68E after 15% discount by mentioning that I found them in Rick Steves" Istanbul Guide Book and showing it at checkin. Stayed in Room #201 (one double bed - main floor - no stairs - no elevator) Great price, location, very good free breakfast buffet, friendly staff, room was on back side away from very little traffic street, good bathroom, TV, AC, Would stay there anytime I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hosts make you feel like your coming home.”
Reviews.Author: tmcbrien
Reviews.Content: We just walked in off the street in our pursuit to find a hotel room and got very lucky to find this hidden gem. We were invited right away to a small wine tasting with owners and staff . What a great way to relax and feel welcome after a long day of travel. I can't say enought about the desk hosts who always went out of ther way to fill a request. Feeling hungery, no problem will send the waiter(from a restraunt down the street) up to our roof top patio so you can enjoy the view with a bottle of local wine.(available in the lobby) The breakfast was very nice and included in the price. WARM FRIENDLY STAFF-DOWN HOME HOSPITALITY!! Thank you all!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made the stay fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: IndieTraveler53
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and fun! The young men who worked the desk loved giving us tips on where to eat, where to go, how to get to the airport most efficiently, etc. The room was very clean and modern! It is very close to a mosque so the Call to Prayer was disturbing, but this would be easy to overlook with a good set of foam earplugs (you hear the call to prayer everywhere!).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful English-speaking staff!”
Reviews.Author: Heather025
Reviews.Content: This adorable 17 room Ottoman hotel next to the Blue Mosque has great prices and a very helpful staff (Thanks Tarik and Gokhan!) The rooms were clean. The breakfast was convenient. Guidebooks, bottled water, phone cards all available in the lobby. As a solo traveler I felt safe and very happy that I chose the 60 Euro hotel room over a hostel. Cheaper if you pay cash!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of Blue mosque with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mimiDH
Reviews.Content: We loved our little corner room on the 5th floor. I requested a double room, but not necessarily with w view, but we got the best room and paid only 80 euros a night including breakfast. Breakfast was great. Olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, bread, cheese, meat, yogurt, coffee or tea and juice was served. We used the hotels shuttle service to get to and from the hotel and found it convenient and reasonably priced. We couldn't have asked for anything better!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Adseldon
Reviews.Content: This clean, well-appointed, and well-run hotel made my stay in Istanbul . I stayed three nights with my brother in a twin room, and after leaving Istanbul for Cappadocia and Ephesus, came back as a solo act for four more nights. It's in a good location behind the Blue Mosque, and while the call to prayer is rather loud every morning around 5:30 AM, it really didn't bother meâ€”it was kind of a mystical snooze alarm. The breakfast buffet had a good variety, and the guys that work at the front desk are accommodating and nice. If you have the Rick Steves' Istanbul book, they'll give you a 15% discount, which makes it a very good deal compared to other Istanbul hotels of the same caliber.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: ninaWestVirginia
Reviews.Content: Perfect decor, perfect setting, great access to sights and transportation. The staff are wonderful, like visiting family only better! They helped us with transportation and figuring out how to get another bed in our room for our son. The view from the terrace is fantastic. Be sure to keep your windows closed at night or you will be blasted by the call to prayer. It would be nice to have snacks on the premises in case of a midnight hunger attack.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dials
Reviews.Content: For someone who had not been to Istanbul in forty years, Sultan Hill was fantastic. My room was spotless, the night view from the roof top terrace incredible, and the help provided by the front desk people was beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: IncurableTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and recommend it highly. All the staff was very helpful, going out of their way to make my stay as carefree as possible. Although nothing fancy, everything was spotless and more than worth the price. I met some other travelers at a cooking class nearby, and they told me about their â€˜very basic, bare-bonesâ€™ youth hostel. It ended up they were paying more than I was for a pretty nice place with breakfast included. Although youâ€™re located right below the Blue Mosque, I never thought the noise was a problem. I stayed during Ramadan when the muezzin called into the late evening and then again at 4:00 am. It did wake me up, but I managed to fall back asleep right away. I actually found the call very melodic and relaxing. Maybe Iâ€™m just a heavy sleeper, but it really didnâ€™t bother me. Breakfast is served in the ground floor. There is a patio to eat outside if itâ€™s nice. Pretty standard items â€“ bread, jam, butter, fruit, cold cereals, juice, hard boiled eggs, some sweetbreads, olives, tomatoes, yogurt, etc. In the lobby they also have a refrigerator with cold water, pop and beer that you can have added to your bill. After a long day of visiting sites, it was nice to return to the hotel and go to the roof terrace to relax and enjoy the view of the Blue Mosque and the ships out in the Sea of Marmara. The stairs are a little steep and the lights on the motion detectors turn off a bit too soon, but otherwise it was a great place. The location canâ€™t be beat as itâ€™s right off the Hippodrome area on a quiet side street. For my trip I divided my time between the Old Town around Sultanahmet and another hotel near Taksim Square. I thought this gave a really nice balance to the city â€“ the historical and the modern, the tourist throngs and the lively cosmopolitan city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pretty, friendly & helpful staff, great view of the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: SusanFreeman
Reviews.Content: My husband & 2 friends stayed here for 2 nights. The rooms were clean with nice furnishings and a good bathroom/shower. Favorite feature was the rooftop patio. The hotel sells drinks in the lobby (beer included) and we spent the evenings watching the sunset, the Blue Mosque, and the water after days of walking the city. Breakfast in the downstairs patio was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Shining in the Shadow of the Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Cat_in_Rabat
Reviews.Content: After scouring through a zillion TA reviews for Istanbul hotels, we settled on the Hotel Sultan Hill in Sultanahmet. First of all, thanks to TA's contributors for hitting the nail on the head: rooms were great, staff super helpful, to-die-for views on the rooftop terrace and the location - 100 metres from the Blue Mosque - couldn't be beat. If anyone complains that the early morning call to prayer was a negative and somehow is the hotel's fault, then they should've stayed away from Istanbul altogether. My husband & I look forward to returning to Istanbul and when we're there, we'll be staying at the Sultan Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Excellent Location-Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: marsle
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for!? We found this hotel in Rick Steves' Istanbul Guidebook and received a 15% discount for showing the book at check-in. We liked our room though small it was clean and cozy with dark wood furniture and double bed with fluffy, white duvet. We stayed a total of 7 nights and found this location to be excellent. It's on a short street behind the Blue Mosque--short walk to the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Arasta Bazaar (easier to deal with than the Grand Bazaar), and the Sultanahmet Tram stop. LOTS of restaurants nearby as well. The Call to Prayer can be a startling wake up call but we got used to it after a couple of days and slept right through. A breakfast of yogurt, tomatoes, olives, cucumbers, juices, breads, and cheeses was served in a pleasant breakfast room. We'll return to Sultan Hill Hotel on our next trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Sultan Hill”
Reviews.Author: sobarch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by Rick Steves' Istanbul, and rightly so. This remodeled hotel is squeaky clean and comfortable. We were offered a 'family room' while negotiating our rooms online. This is a perfect arrangement for nearly any age family as it consists of two adjoining rooms with a shared small foyer. The foyer has its own key so we could leave our big keys in the room and only have to track the smaller key. The rooms have both heat and aircon. The plumbing is great and the beds are not bad. The staff here is warm and helpful. The included breakfast is sufficient and tasty and I am writing this review on the hotel's hand free internet. I would come back here again especially if my goal was to explore the historic Sultanahmet area. Very conveniently located to sites and restaurants and shops. The only possible drawback might be its proximity to the Blue Mosque with its very loud call to prayer in the morning. Excellent hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great views in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chotano
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this friendly small hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of a visit to Turkey and 1 night at the end of our visit. It is restored to resemble the original 18th century Ottoman house that had been on the site. The owners are very friendly and helpful. Our room with 2 double beds was small but comfortable and very clean with a bathroom, small refrigerator, safe, and TV. The hotel is practically in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and the view from the rooftop terrace is spectacular. There is wireless internet available without charge. I especially liked the pastries made before my eyes at breakfast with an outdoor patio next to the breakfast room. It was easy to get to using the metro/tram from the airport with a short walk across the Hippodrome. They arranged a taxi for our early morning ride to the airport. It is just 1/2 block from the Hippodrome and an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and Underground Cistern. There are a number of cafes and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel - Exactly What I Was Looking For!”
Reviews.Author: Wolftrapper
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the hotel reviews on Trip Advisor I chose the Hotel Sultan Hill for my nine night stay in lovely Istanbul. This hotel was also a recommend hotel in the Rick Steves' guidebook. I was extremely happy with my selection. The Sultan Hill provided me with just want I like in hotel: a clean, comfortable hotel in an excellent location at an attractive rate. If you are like me and would prefer save money on lodging and spend it elsewhere on your trip, I highly recommend this hotel. First off, let me say that I donâ€™t think that you can find a better location in Istanbul. You are right in the heart of the Sultanahmet area. The hotel is right behind the Blue Mosque and around the corner from the Hippodrome. Bear in mind that you will hear the calls to prayer throughout the day because of the hotelâ€™s close proximity to the Blue Mosque. It is all part of the charm of being in Istanbul and I found it to be not nearly as much of a concern as I had anticipated it might be. If this concerns you, a set of earplugs will take care of it. From the hotel you are in easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Galata Bridge and many other sites. You are also a very short walk to the tram stop. What a great location! My room was very nice and very clean. While small by American standards, I thought is a decent size compared to other rooms I have had throughout Europe. The bathroom was clean and modern and the shower and water pressure worked perfectly. The two young men who worked at the reception desk were both very nice and helpful. The hotel manager, Sedat, was also very personable, kind and helpful. All of them spoke very good English. The hotel has a great rooftop terrace which to my surprise did not get utilized by guests as much as it should. In any event, I spent some time up there every day. It provides a terrific view of the Blue Mosque, which is right next to the hotel, the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara. In the distance you have a good view of the Princess Islands. I got some great photos from the terrace. Breakfast is served downstairs in the breakfast room. It is a simple buffet, nothing fancy, but certainly adequate to start the day. There were hard boiled eggs, breads, toast, cold cuts, cheese, olives, cakes, yogurt, cereal, as well as coffee and tea. The two women who manage the breakfast room were both very nice. One of them even made some delicious honey baklava for the buffet. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travelers looking for a good value. It's clean and comfortable and central to the main sites and to public transport. If I am fortunate enough to return to Istanbul, the Hotel Sultan Hill will be place I will stay. For cost conscious travelers, this hotel is a â€œdiamond in the roughâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel for cost conscious travelers”
Reviews.Author: Liketotravel38
Reviews.Content: If you don't like to waste money on 5 star hotels than I highly recommend this hotel. What I liked most about the hotel was its location (across the street from Blue Mosque and around the corner from Hippodrome). Ideal location. Rooms were very clean (and serviced every day) and the folks who ran the place spoke English and were very kind and helpful. What I liked least was the very small size of the room. I have stayed in many small European hotels in my years traveling and this was the smallest . To be fare, the manager told me up front when I booked that the room was smaller than the others and I got a great rate. Frankly, I only use hotel rooms to sleep and shower so it was not much of problem for us. It might be a problem for others. If so, avoid #304 Some other items: - breakfast was simple but adequate. Cereal, toast, juice, coffee/tea, hard boiled eggs, ham (i think), cheese. certainly enough to start the day and make it to lunch -bathrooms seemed relatively new and always clean. Great shower. -nice rooftop deck with view of Blue Mosque. Got some good pics from up there. Unfortunately, breakfast is served in the basement and it's 3-4 floors up to the roof. never tried to negotiate the stairs with a plate of food and coffee otherwise it would be a great place to have breakfast. -Since the hotel is across from the mosque you will hear the call to prayer at 5am each day but isn't that part of the allure of Istanbul? After a few days of enjoying the charm I used ear plugs in the eve and slept like a babe right through the whole thing I would recommend this hotel to all budget travelers. It's central to the main sites and to public transport. If you looking for opulence, a football field size room and a swimming pool, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOwordtraveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to say enough nice things about the Hotel Sultan Hill. The rooms were new, clean and comfortable. And the staff was very very helpful. For starters, I arrived very late (ie 4am). But I had no issues checking in. Someone was there and ready to help me with my bags. I was thrilled when I entered my room. Big bed with fresh clean sheets and plenty of towels. There was more than enough space for me to hang my clothes and put away my luggage. The bathroom was small, but modern. I looked forward to my hot, powerful showers. And my room was cleaned every day, and I got fresh towels every day. The hotel has WiFi throughout. But I didn't have a laptop, so the staff let me use the computer at the front desk. Breakfast was simple, but I always left full. Don't go in expecting something lavish. There were boiled eggs, toast, cold cuts, cheese, yogurt and cereal. Oh, and you can't ask for a better location if you want to stay in the Sultanahmet area. It's literally behind the Blue Mosque. And yes, because of where their situated, the call to prayer every morning is inescapable. But you're going to hear it regardless of where you stay. And it's all part of the experience. Everything on the Sultanahment side was within a comfortable walking distance. And the tram to take you over to Taksim Square was less than a 5 minute walk away. The only minor issue I had was easily remedied. I found if I left the air conditioner on all night, I'd be very cold. So I just asked for another blanket. If you're looking for a clean, simple, friendly place to stay that won't break the bank, go to Hotel Sultan Hill.
